intro: Onosma ambigens, commonly known as the ambiguous sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Onosma ambigens is often found in alpine meadows and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
